name: Become a Data Superhero with Ruby
tagline: A Crash Course for The Iron Yard - Indianapolis
body:
# Being a superhero can be a dangerous occupation 

## Course materials

- If you haven't already, sign up for a [Cloud 9 account](https://c9.io/). We'll be using Cloud 9 as our programming environment this evening.
- We'll be using this link as our template for tonight's project (more later): `https://github.com/theironyard-indy/avengerscc.git`

## Description

In this crash course, we explore the Ruby programming language and use it to answer some burning questions about America's most popular superhero team - The Avengers.

- How likely are you to die when you join The Avengers? 
- If you die, how likely are you to come back? 
- Do male Avengers die more often than women? 
- Wait. Just how many folks have been in the Avengers anyway?
- And more!

#### Along the way, you'll learn about:

- Variables 
- Arrays 
- Hashes 
- Data Structures 
- CSVs 
- Enumerable
- Comic books

_Of note: We won't be delving into Ruby on Rails, the popular Ruby-based web application framework. Ruby itself is fun enough to fill an evening._
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
